author: James Joyce
text: Dear Mr Pinker: Many thanks for cheque (£7.9.) I saw Mr George Moore before I left London and he told me he would write a preface for Dujardin’s book if you got a publisher for it. Mr Stuart Gilbert, one of the translators of the French Ulysse, has offered to translate it. Will you please tell me if you have offered it to the Mandrake Press, 41 Nursery Street, and, if so, whether they will do it? Sincerely yours James Joyce
